sorry for the double posts, I wonder why that happens.

Nevermind, I got it!

Thethrush, install the game in the "program files", then copy the crack and the language file to c:/programfiles/commander-conquestoftheseas.
After that, add steam_api.dll to your antivirus exception list. THAT was my problem. The antivirus prevented the game from being launched because of this.

If you use AVG like I do, go to tools, then advanced settings, then resident shield, then excluded files.

And no, you do not need Steam for the game to work.

Great torrent as per usual, thanks reloaded!

TO INSTALL THE GAME!!
(this is just a repeat of spag007s post as he was spot on)

Run steambackup application.
(it will come up asking for install location)
Set it to program files, (or program files x86)
It will then install.
Add steam_api.dll from the crack folder to resident shield.
Copy it to the game folder in program files along with the language file
Add the steam_api.dll that you just moved into your programs files folder to your resident shield also.
Run the game exe.
Have fun playing the game
buy it to support the developers

Hey dudes, i figured out the "not existing dir" problem. Acutally I had the same problem on win 7 64 when i wanted to install in program files x86. So what you do instead is to install it in a some dir that you dont need administrator things.

Fox example most if you have multiple partition that you use for windows and other for files backing etc then use the second one.... I hope this is clear...
